p: Haloculture refers to all economic activities related to agriculture in very saline soils and water conditions ( Pirasteh-Anosheh et al., 2016). In other words, haloculture means agriculture with saline water in saline land - an unconventional agriculture. Haloculture operates in hyper-saline and saline lands, in which conventional farming is no longer economical or feasible. Therefore, it is not a competitor for common agriculture, but can be a suitable supplement ( Khorsandi et al., 2020; Yensen, 2002).
